subject: postdoc and phd student positions in  robotics at ku leuven - belgium
content: apologies for multiple postings dear colleagues, in the ku leuven robotics research group postdoc we have opened postdoc and phd student positions. more information can be found through: postdoc position in robotic software system engineering - ref. bap-2017-173<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icts.kuleuven.be_apps_jobsite_vacatures_54120464&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rc03axvbo9xwopvd-q_ljegw_7epupfghacwwe-knl0&s=ptvf9ykzhizlktzgaz9txzkrwxigmcnygwxu_s8zu5w&e= > doctoral researcher in robotic software system engineering and estimation in robotics - ref. bap-2017-172<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__icts.kuleuven.be_apps_jobsite_vacatures_54120450&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rc03axvbo9xwopvd-q_ljegw_7epupfghacwwe-knl0&s=wh2axunwazg6lrjw88awr2xvwqyjpphnk8sbxbbk5bq&e= > the robotics research group at the department of mechanical engineering, division of production engineering, machine design and automation (pma), started its robotics activities in the mid-1970s. the group was among the first to develop active force feedback for assembly operations. already in 1980 it developed learning insertion algorithms based on stochastic automata. it has covered virtually all aspects of sensor-based robotics, from the high-level task specification down to low-level sensor-based control, and applied the research results in a variety of industrial applications. in the last decade the group shifted its attention towards service robots (behaviour-based mobile manipulation, shared control, learning control), medical robotics (natural interfaces, haptic bilateral control), industrial robot assistants, and active sensing. pma has created several spin-off companies that are active in robotics-related activities, has initiated several free and open-source software projects in robotics (orocos, kdl, itasc, ...), and has participated in a large number of robotics and control oriented eu projects. location: leuven, belgium application deadline: april 30, 2017 kind regards, wilm decr? -- dr. ir. wilm decr? ku leuven departement werktuigkunde, afdeling pma celestijnenlaan 300 - bus 2420 3001 heverlee belgi? tel. +32 16 37 26 86 fax +32 16 32 28 38 wilm.decre at kuleuven.be<mailto:wilm.decre at kuleuven.be> www.mech.kuleuven.be<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mech.kuleuven.be&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rc03axvbo9xwopvd-q_ljegw_7epupfghacwwe-knl0&s=p8vqry4dhdgria9paw5gw1dtzhoausiddkbvwa1y4ng&e= >

subject: phd position in humanoid robotics at  loria, france
content: the loria lab (nancy, france) is hiring a full-time phd student (3-year fully-funded position) on the subject of humanoid robot whole-body motion planning and control. the candidate will conduct his/her research in the larsen team (?life-long autonomy for robots in a sensing environment?) and will benefit from the high-end equipment of the team including an icub humanoid robot and a last-generation state-of-the-art full-size humanoid robot that the team will acquire by the year 2019. the research is taking place in the aftermath of the 2015 darpa robotics challenge (drc), and the thesis will capitalize on the lessons and errors learned during the challenge especially regarding whole-body motion controllers, footstep planners, com trajectory planners, and humanoid state estimators. interested candidates are invited to contact karim bouyarmane ( karim.bouyarmane at loria.fr) for more details on the subject no later than may 29 (sunday). early contact prior to application is strongly encouraged. international applications are welcome. no knowledge of french language is required. the position will start around september-october 2017 at the convenience of the candidate (further adjustment will be possible on a case-by-case basis). a master?s degree or equivalent in robotics, control theory, computer science, electrical engineering, or closely related field is required. the candidate will have successfully completed his/her degree before the starting date. the candidate will have to demonstrate strong technical skills and experience in c++, ros, matlab, linux environment software development. the recruitment process is highly competitive and a strong academic record with relevant courses should appear in the transcript that the candidate will have attached to their application. about loria and nancy: the loria lab is a joint laboratory between universit? de lorraine and two french national public research organizations, the cnrs (main public research organization in france, interdisciplinary) and inria (main public research organization in mathematics, informatics). the graduate student will be enrolled as a universit? de lorraine phd student. universit? de lorraine is the fifth largest french university with over 52000 students (7900 international students) on several campuses in the lorraine region (french north-eastern region close to germany, luxemburg, belgium). nancy is a medium-size city conveniently located within 1.5 hour train ride from paris center and 1.5 hour train ride from charles de gaulle airport (high-speed rail lines, tgv). interested candidates should contact karim bouyarmane ( karim.bouyarmane at loria.fr) as early as possible, and no later than may 29 (early contact/application is strongly encouraged). karim bouyarmane assistant professor, universit? de lorraine, loria lab, larsen team team website : https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_larsen_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wz2galab_yap9iut29imro_c1yn7lepmr6ixutzcihm&s=aomvy-hafhfjp2lq85j36objffpa9nv5gor0pu6lfsg&e=  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__members.loria.fr_kbouyarmane_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wz2galab_yap9iut29imro_c1yn7lepmr6ixutzcihm&s=yfvcoal9tzn86njdibqz4gubkqbg5n92ij5wpjowy1e&e=

subject: 2 post-doc positions @ uclouvain  (robotics and biomechanics)
content: two post-doctoral positions are currently open within the institute of  mechanics, materials and civil engineering at uclouvain (belgium), in  the framework of collaborative projects. one is in the field of  rehab/assistive robotics and the other in biomechanics. please follow the links to euraxess for more information and application  instructions: position 1 (rehab/assistive robotics):  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__euraxess.ec.europa.eu_jobs_225239&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bqqalg7lnxt-_zsy4g2d6p6wvjuram2ahhc9djd0tsi&s=pocg3q1jt0i4q5rc5n3jrhldr_qwtlrfsmhz9p8j1jc&e= ; and position 2  (biomechanics): https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__euraxess.ec.europa.eu_jobs_225220&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bqqalg7lnxt-_zsy4g2d6p6wvjuram2ahhc9djd0tsi&s=qqh0lotsdmofudejqg7arkrnf0xenkoi_cw4lf3ddca&e=  --  signature renaud ronsse assistant professor center for research in energy and mechatronics institute of mechanics, materials, and civil engineering place du levant, 2 bte l5.04.02 b-1348 louvain-la-neuve renaud.ronsse at uclouvain.be <mailto:renaud.ronsse at uclouvain.be> tel. 32 (0)10 47 47 96 - fax 32 (0)10 47 25 01 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__perso.uclouvain.be_renaud.ronsse_&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bqqalg7lnxt-_zsy4g2d6p6wvjuram2ahhc9djd0tsi&s=e55ols9_85valdwlov21lv1txwmaw2-lzhycqimax74&e=  	uclouvain

subject: cto position at axiles bionics (be  spin-off - ai, robotics & lower limb prosthetics)
content: axiles bionics is looking for a chief technology officer. axiles bionics is a new brussels spin-off, from de vrije universiteit brussel (be), developing the newest generation robotic ankle-foot prosthesis. our mission is to improve the quality of life of amputees by bringing this newest bionic foot to the market. awards : best startup contest @ iros 2017 website : www.axilesbionics.com your mission: - contribute to the vision of the company as co-founder - manage the r&d team & product development - responsible for the ai, control & software implementation - responsible for relationship with universities, research institutions and suppliers - follow-up market trends and innovations your profile: - master in engineering or computer science (phd is a +) - advanced knowledge in ai, robotics & control - work experience within industry or research preferable - open minded, creative and analytical thinker, effective communicator our offer: - a challenging job in an innovative startup in advanced robotics - international context based in brussels, belgium - competitive salary conditions (incl. company shares and company car) contact information: dr. ir. pierre cherelle pierre.cherelle at axilesbionics.com www.linkedin.com/in/pierrecherelle

subject: phd position - vascular pathfinder,  development of a smart robotic catheter - university of leuven, belgium
content: the robot-assisted surgery (ras) group of ku leuven (belgium) is offering a fully funded phd position on :  "vascular pathfinder, development of a smart robotic catheter" recruitment starts immediately and runs until a suited candidate is found.  application can be done online via  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__icts.kuleuven.be_apps_jobsite_-23_vacatures_54501520&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=utfad3seer87wvxzyiose1y2pc_wggverqflxd3xab4&s=aquammtbqb7djkj22txx5euzxpxbozfdtfadvyyua0e&e= background:  the advent of minimally invasive surgery caused no less than a revolution in surgery reducing the need to create large incisions, allowing surgeons to access the targeted organs and tissue through a number of long slender but rigid instruments. these days a 2nd technology-pushed evolution is taking place as attention shifts to developing flexible instruments to replace former rigid devices. these flexible instruments enter the body through similar or even smaller incisions. in contrast to their rigid counterparts flexible instruments can more easily adjust shape and conform to their surroundings. aside from an increased dexterity (workspace) they are potentially safer in use. being compliant they can give away upon contact and give the surgeon more time to react. with embedded sensing it becomes possible to improve the understanding of the instrument's configuration or from the tissue that is treated. this information is vital if one wants to control the catheter deliberately and precisely through such fragile environment. however, up to now there are no proper measurement systems available that allow measuring this distribution interaction force with enough precision. the goal of this project consists in 1) designing a measurement system that can measure sufficiently rapid this information and 2) using this real-time information to drive the catheter. the `vascular pathfinder' becomes a catheter that `blindly' moves itself through the vasculature.   candidate profile: within this phd the candidate will design new measurements systems, models and algorithms to estimate the interaction force or pressure that is applied on a flexible instrument such as a catheter. a strong affinity with measurement technology, mechanical design, machining and precision mechanics is very much welcomed. apart from tailoring these instruments for a particular application, through this phd we seek to understand and address the requirements necessary to bring this technology right into the clinic. issues like mass-manufacturing, bio-compatibility, sterilization and safety - will need to be addressed in order to allow validation in clinical trials. the project will happen in collaboration with a belgian sme that develops high-end optical measurement systems. the candidate should therefore have a practical mindset and a desire to see his/her developments transferred to the industry. in fact the research and development will take place 50% at the company and  50% at the university.  we are looking for enthusiastic candidates in the possession of a master degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, robotics, biomechanical engineering, computer science or similar. applications should contain a c.v., a cover letter describing research interests and goals, a full list of publications, names and contact information for up to three references (letters of recommendation can be included to strengthen further the application). location: the group's laboratory is located in heverlee, celestijnenlaan 300b (belgium) at walking distance from the university hospital and the campus group t in the dekenstraat where the didactic tasks will take place. the research group performs at international level thanks to a close collaboration between engineers from the engineering and science, engineering technology, biomedical engineering disciplines, clinicians and surgeons. located just above the workshop, in the middle between the electronics lab and the robotics research group all technical and know-how is within close reach. interested ? for more information do not hesitate to send a mail to mailto:emmanuel.vanderpoorten at kuleuven.be. you can apply for this job no later than march 30, 2018 online via https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__icts.kuleuven.be_apps_jobsite_-23_vacatures_54501520&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=utfad3seer87wvxzyiose1y2pc_wggverqflxd3xab4&s=aquammtbqb7djkj22txx5euzxpxbozfdtfadvyyua0e&e= note that the position remains open until an excellent candidate is selected (so not necessarily until march 30).  dr. e.b. vander poorten, assist. prof., surgical robotics, haptic interfacing, teleoperation & training dept. of mechanical engineering, celestijnenlaan 300, b-3001 heverlee, belgium mailto:emmanuel.vanderpoorten at kuleuven.be tel: +32/(0)16.32.25.28??

subject: tenure-track academic position in  intelligent robotics
content: the university of liege (uliege), belgium, invites applications for a tenure-track full-time faculty position in "intelligent robotics" in the department of electrical engineering and computer science (montefiore institute) of the school of engineering and computer science, to be filled ideally by october 1st, 2018, and no later than january 1st, 2019. application deadline: march 31, 2018 for details, refer to https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.montefiore.ulg.ac.be_tenure-2dtrack-2dfaculty-2dposition-2din-2dintelligent-2drobotics&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8sspv3lv57j4909dx4vop-k5pt_tr1tnhqdclwwuvo0&s=dw3c1ikmkhzbusrtqcvuk37_gxxphirzt2hvdhcvkzs&e=

subject: research internship opening on '3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation' at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it> references: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it>
content: fellow junior (research internship) opening on ?3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation? at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: april 23, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 4-5 months with potential follow up enrolment to continue for phd studies. potential topics (one should be selected):   -- "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   -- "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use" tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics lab at the department of advanced robotics of the italian institute of technology (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 4-5 months research intern (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots.   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (walk-man.eu), centauro (centauro-project.eu) , or cogimon (cogimon.eu) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements: 1. to be eligible, you must have recently (at most 6 months) completed a masters degree, or expect to complete soon. 2. this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable. 3. ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills. 4. machine learning and computer vision skills are required. 5. knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus. 6. the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. ?center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing?, ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it), quoting [hhcm-internship] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mf9cjq5bvy3qwmknvrql-rzonxse_r3kjdevvbf7uqk&s=o4o4u46clqpflwxesf8fje8_21o9zspab2df5mr0rbs&e=

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <45b5e8bf547a4ff4b54a6d1171e27535@iit.it> references: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it>,  <45b5e8bf547a4ff4b54a6d1171e27535@iit.it>

reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it), quoting [hhcm-internship] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yaikleujs-bjdbyzyks9nil8rbpebwl62xqhx77v9qo&s=v-uxqouuetwj3ciz-x3o1aquqizaoffc2xf1fxm-rm4&e=

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <928a581bb9c14ed7a610e489dcb5aa3c@iit.it> references: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it>,  <45b5e8bf547a4ff4b54a6d1171e27535@iit.it>,  <928a581bb9c14ed7a610e489dcb5aa3c@iit.it>
content: fellow junior (research internship) opening on "3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: april 23, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 4-5 months with potential follow up enrollment to continue for phd studies. potential topics (one should be selected):   -- "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   -- "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use" tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics lab at the department of advanced robotics of the italian institute of technology (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 4-5 months research intern (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots.   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (walk-man.eu), centauro (centauro-project.eu) , or cogimon (cogimon.eu) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements: 1. to be eligible, you must have recently (at most 6 months) completed a masters degree, or expect to complete soon. 2. this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable. 3. ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills. 4. machine learning and computer vision skills are required. 5. knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus. 6. the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it), quoting [hhcm-internship] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eedp3_9hqjoz6redlzduvr0ov60qifbgwzncox8bzcy&s=so6f7p4tdoujc15m8ldlj4xeah_t-je7gi71c2hytyu&e=

content: fellow (research internship) opening on "3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=f4hev3r00rzjur6k9fh5wafihyuy4fgof8-4oh1mkqm&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulatio&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=vuenv52qwh-7pgcmbw6-wtpgfkszah2ml6oli37khry&e=><https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=f4hev3r00rzjur6k9fh5wafihyuy4fgof8-4oh1mkqm&e=> where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: july 9, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 6+ months with potential follow up enrollment to continue for phd studies. tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 6 months fellow (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (www.walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (www.centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots. we are looking for highly motivated candidates with a msc degree in electrical/computer engineering/science. potential topics (one should be selected):   *   "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   *   "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use"   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.walk-2dman.eu_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=lcxiy3tqdmqmzbud0ct37uidynxk0-ft7xapqp_sipe&e=), centauro (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.centauro-2dproject.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=iiytos0j9r3c13q-3norytsz6smuiagdo-m5jwmzxh4&e=) , or cogimon (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cogimon.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=8rn2h7pf_tg7lv7sdxsrzw9th1scig7a0jsfede3ohw&e=) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements:   *   the person in interest should have acquired a master degree (obtained within the past six months from the application) in a relevant field.   *   this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable.   *   ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills.   *   machine learning and computer vision skills are required.   *   knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus.   *   the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv  (deadline july 9, 2018) electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit<mailto:dimitrios.kanoulas at iit> (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it<mailto:nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it>), quoting [hhcm-internship - cb75158 ] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=wqcm5qzvpnyxjmfpccmv32ftotxoi62zum2sqc18ggk&e=

subject: phd and postdoc positions in robotics  at ku leuven - belgium
content: apologies for multiple postings dear colleagues, for the robotics research group at the department of mechanical engineering, division of production engineering, machine design and automation (pma), ku leuven, we are looking for excellent phd and postdoc candidates: postdoc position in discrete task-level robot programming and world modelling https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54707562&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mp-5rrkkaihbialq_ruigf-qoocwreccwhjy8jwde84&s=m57kxzohg_szqmttxejqwly0et906j14wb7mprv5sfs&e= phd student in discrete task-level robot programming and world modelling https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54706405&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mp-5rrkkaihbialq_ruigf-qoocwreccwhjy8jwde84&s=2ud4ss4seomxlf4mgskowc9ldig_agqoaq_nihwgc9o&e= postdoctoral position - generalizing human-demonstrated robot skills https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54707562&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mp-5rrkkaihbialq_ruigf-qoocwreccwhjy8jwde84&s=m57kxzohg_szqmttxejqwly0et906j14wb7mprv5sfs&e= phd position - generalizing human-demonstrated robot skills https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54669211&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mp-5rrkkaihbialq_ruigf-qoocwreccwhjy8jwde84&s=hsnggljtd_gizzwdeet5uoucfzcy2fhmmsggiprplu0&e= location: leuven, belgium application deadline: august 31, 2018. the positions might be filled in earlier if excellent candidates are found. the group started its robotics activities in the mid-1970s and was among the first to develop active force feedback for assembly operations. already in 1980 it developed learning insertion algorithms based on stochastic automata. it has covered virtually all aspects of sensor-based robotics, from the high-level task specification down to low-level sensor-based control, and applied the research results in a variety of industrial applications. in the last decade the group shifted its attention towards service robots (behavior-based mobile manipulation, shared control, learning control), medical robotics (natural interfaces, haptic bilateral control), industrial robot assistants, and active sensing. pma has created several spin-off companies that are active in robotics-related activities, has initiated several free and open-source software projects in robotics (orocos, kdl, itasc, etasl, .), and has participated in a large number of robotics and control oriented eu projects. kind regards, wilm decr? -- dr. ir. wilm decr? research manager ku leuven department of mechanical engineering, division pma celestijnenlaan 300 - box 2420 3001 heverlee belgium tel. +32 16 37 26 86 fax +32 16 32 28 38 mailto:wilm.decre at kuleuven.be https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mech.kuleuven.be_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mp-5rrkkaihbialq_ruigf-qoocwreccwhjy8jwde84&s=i20gtxhdmedjzm5xzwu7-bwfissqwvu7v9pssnuiinq&e= member of flanders make

subject: full-time professor vacancy in machines  and mechatronics under energy optimization at ku leuven (campus bruges,  belgium)
content: professor vacancy in machines and mechatronics under energy optimization ku leuven, campus bruges, belgium [closing monday 1 october 2018] the department of mechanical engineering of ku leuven at the technology campus bruges has a full-time academic vacancy (professor) in the domain of machine design. the department of mechanical engineering is one of the key players in the field of mechanical processing and mechanical design within europe. the department is involved in a large number of national and international research projects and has acquired a unique research infrastructure. it has a strong link with the university's tech transfer office lrd and with flemish and european research institutes for technology transfer. the department has also been very successful in the creation of spin-off companies, illustrating the socio-economic relevance of its research. many of these spin-off companies (like nikon-metrology, materialise, 3dsystems-layerwise, siemens industry software) are technology leaders within their domain, and their products and services are renowned internationally.  the research activities on machine design and mechatronics are a multi-disciplinary collaboration, called group-m, between the technology clusters on electronics technology, computer science and mechanical engineering technology on the ku leuven campus bruges. with this vacancy, the mechanical engineering department is strategically reinforcing the mechanical engineering research aspects in the research group machine design and mechatronics at campus bruges. this campus is one of seven remote ku leuven campuses of the faculty of engineering technology and is evolving to a strong industrially related research center with the appropriate expertise and infrastructure with respect to machine design. through the integration in campus bruges and in the mechanical engineering department in heverlee you will have access to a solid research infrastructure, an extensive international research network, connections with industry and non-profit organisations, a steady offer of talented phd researchers and a supporting work environment embedded in a multi-disciplinary network with other ku leuven research departments. closing date for applications: monday 1 october 2018 link to full job ad and application procedure: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54649163-3fhl-3den-26lang-3den&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ig_zu1kpeverj-yrw7n4zgm2sbl5v3o-nfftt2cej2k&s=qjk9ceudgxxyokeycm7jrq_24sl1zk8zocajl53ai1i&e=

subject: postdoc position - surgical robotics -  university of leuven, belgium
content: the department of mechanical engineering at the university of leuven invites applications  for a postdoctoral position in the area of robotic micro-surgery.  recruitment starts immediately and runs until a suited candidate is found.  application can be done online via  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54871598&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rcxpqdlu1hp0gnans7ikgmncccetrosbhxcsda_9guy&s=b6msugssskynvobqnor_kqp2db93zzov-r8iedoxswi&e= we seek outstanding postdoctoral applicants to strengthen this expanding research group. a fully-funded position starting between november 2018 and january 2019 for the duration of one year, with possible extension, is available. we are looking for goal-oriented candidates with proven experience in mechanical design and control of surgical robots and advanced instrumentation. candidates in the possession of a phd in engineering on topics such as surgical robotics, medical image processing, design of medical devices, human-robot interaction, mechatronics or general robotics can apply.  the successful candidate will take a leading role in the work on robotic micro-surgery, both in ophthalmological, ent or skull-base surgery and tackle both hard and software challenges. he/she will support phd students active in these fields and will get the opportunity to identify new contributions in the respective fields. the successful candidate will have a large responsibility for these particular projects, but is also expected to pro-actively engage and collaborate with parallel activities in the research group.   the robot-assisted surgery group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.mech.kuleuven.be_en_pma_research_ras&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rcxpqdlu1hp0gnans7ikgmncccetrosbhxcsda_9guy&s=8qsgmst3stqin7fxg8fyp2olmppua66esmcjan6uq9m&e=) is an international,  growing, dynamic and multi-disciplinary research group consisting of members of pma (production engineering, machine building and automation) and bme (biomechanical engineering),  which maintains tight and multiple collaborations with uz leuven, the largest university hospital in belgium, located at 10 minutes ride (bicycle) of the department. the group has coordinated several collaborative eu-projects such as scath and cascade project on robotic catheterization, eureyecase on robotic eye-surgery. through the gift-surg project (wellcome trust / epsrc funded) we have gained experience in fetal surgery where we work closely with university college london and king's college london. other active research lines include amongst others bilateral teleoperation, haptics, shared control, bio-mechanical tissue modelling, real-time fem, human intention recognition, surgical training and robotic laser surgery.   applications should contain a c.v., a cover letter describing research interests and goals, a full list of publications, copies of up to three relevant papers, and names and contact information for at least three references (expected to provide letters of recommendation). application procedure: please refer to https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_54871598&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rcxpqdlu1hp0gnans7ikgmncccetrosbhxcsda_9guy&s=b6msugssskynvobqnor_kqp2db93zzov-r8iedoxswi&e= for application details.  the envisioned starting date between november 1, 2018 and january 31, 2019 (recruitment will continue until suitable candidate is found)  please feel free to contact us for further information. in such case, please insert "ras postdoc - robotic micro-surgery" as header in all your communication. dr. e.b. vander poorten, assist. prof., surgical robotics, haptic interfacing, teleoperation & training dept. of mechanical engineering, celestijnenlaan 300, b-3001 heverlee, belgium mailto:emmanuel.vanderpoorten at kuleuven.be tel: +32/(0)16.32.25.28

subject: intern position open at toyota europe -  robotics
content: team/division description: the hsr, one of toyota's mobility concepts developed within our goal to provide freedom of mobility for all, is part of the toyota partner robots family. it reflects our commitment to enriching lives of communities with a focus on nursing and healthcare, short-distance transport and home-living. as a compact mobile manipulator with a folding arm, it can pick up objects up off the floor and retrieve objects from shelves. it performs a variety of other tasks to improve the quality of life of elderly people or people with disabilities. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3ddebvsrd8sns&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_goyuwhahduzgxs_ydo0phagcigbenwbgpbqpgqerxw&s=8rxqwfzanvsdj6cg1uwjwftr76hzwzb0oyr1blya7g0&e= your project: the intern will contribute to a modular software stack for our service robot, hsr.  the role includes a wide range of areas such development, integration and testing of existing software modules. the main areas of activity will be in the areas of creating or integrating modules to implement functionality needed for specific workflows. these will contribute to use-case evaluations and demonstrations. your profile background: * bachelor, masters or phd in robotics, computer science, electronic engineering, mechatronics. * keen interest in service robotics, especially robotics to assist the elderly and handicapped. * strong background in software is a plus. skills: * ubuntu and ros (robot operating system) * python, c++ * version control (git) * knowledge of docker is a plus * knowledge of gtest is a plus place of employment: technical center, hoge wei 33, b-1930 zaventem, belgium starting date: asap duration: ideally 6-12 month confidentiality: due to business requirement, not all performed projects can be reflected in the internship report. this issue needs to be discussed with candidate/school in advance. it is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship. interested in this internship, please apply online via https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__intern-2dtoyota-2deurope.icims.com_jobs_2266_intern-2drobotics-2dsoftware_job-3fhub-3d9&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=_goyuwhahduzgxs_ydo0phagcigbenwbgpbqpgqerxw&s=vqr6mloek8xov6mpn3gig0sabqtnjaxuxk8ujkvryoe&e=. this e-mail may contain confidential information. if you are not an addressee or otherwise authorised to receive this message, you should not use, copy, disclose or take any action based on this e-mail. if you have received this e-mail in error, please inform the sender promptly and delete this message and any attachments immediately.

subject: intern position open at toyota europe -  deep learning
content: team/division description: the hsr, one of toyota's mobility concepts developed within our goal to provide freedom of mobility for all, is part of the toyota partner robots family. it reflects our commitment to enriching lives of communities with a focus on nursing and healthcare, short-distance transport and home-living. as a compact mobile manipulator with a folding arm, it can pick up objects up off the floor and retrieve objects from shelves. it performs a variety of other tasks to improve the quality of life of elderly people or people with disabilities. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_watch-3fv-3ddebvsrd8sns&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=z1yfi9y99axxodk15gzuumhn6jpopwtl382mjxtllls&s=gda3zwfb4o_a_kdwhr0b_buld3udl-0awp_gtjjhthi&e= your project: the intern will work in the robotics team amongst specialists in computer vision and deep learning.  support tme robotics team in on leading r&d projects applying this technology to the field of service robotics. the main areas of activity will be in supporting the team in running evaluations of deep learning algorithms, porting algorithms to new frameworks, tuning performance and proposing new solutions. your profile background: * masters or phd in computer science, computer vision, mathematics, electronic engineering, robotics. * previous experience in software, deep learning and computer visions. * keen interest in service robotics, especially robotics to assist the elderly and handicapped. skills: * any of: python, c++, lua * any of: tensorflow, theano, pytorch, caffe * version control (git) * knowledge of docker is a plus place of employment: technical center, hoge wei 33, b-1930 zaventem, belgium starting date: asap duration: ideally 6 to 12 month confidentiality: due to business requirement, not all performed projects can be reflected in the internship report. this issue needs to be discussed with candidate/school in advance. it is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship. interested in this internship, please apply online via https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__intern-2dtoyota-2deurope.icims.com_jobs_2265_intern-2dcomputer-2dvision-2dand-2ddeep-2dlearning_job-3fhub-3d9&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=z1yfi9y99axxodk15gzuumhn6jpopwtl382mjxtllls&s=fx3zlwaxjgq0nclwdd6dnhodncmwlyfufosup5-b-oo&e= this e-mail may contain confidential information. if you are not an addressee or otherwise authorised to receive this message, you should not use, copy, disclose or take any action based on this e-mail. if you have received this e-mail in error, please inform the sender promptly and delete this message and any attachments immediately.

subject: phd position: ai-guided robotics for  surgical navigation references: <599148298.83369.1539760985247.ref@mail.yahoo.com>
content: job description minimal invasive image-guided interventions (mii) is emerging as a new discipline in medicine. to date, no single specialist area has the necessary competencies to deliver mii. these interventions are combined with sophisticated imaging technologies, primarily to perform minimally invasive surgery. mii can be characterized by the following key steps: target location, target verification (lesion volume), target destruction, treatment monitoring and verification. smart mechatronic devices can be developed to enhance surgeon manipulation skills. it include dexterous instrument, comanipulated tool holder. these systems require new intuitive control mode that uses image guidance, haptic feedback to fit into the clinical workflow. dedicated man-machine interfaces will allow the user selecting the appropriate assistance. the aim of this project is to develop algorithms that provide shared-control between the robotic system and the clinician supported by image-guidance and deep learning algorithms as feedback to the robotic system. additionally, the system creates an adaptive clinical workflow that can be adjusted based on the personalized treatment planning. this project is part of european consortium that includes industrial, clinical and academic partners from the netherlands,  sweden  and belgium. your profile the successful applicant has a background in robotics, control, mechatronics, bio-mechatronics, biomedical engineering or in a closely related discipline. he or she should possess excellent skills and practical experience in one or more of the following research areas: mathematical optimization, mechatronics, machine and deep learning or image processing and experience with programming. experience at the intersection of one or more of these areas is desirable. fluency in english is required. an interview will be part of the selection procedure. information and application questions regarding this position can be directed to dr.ir. momen abayazid, phone: +31-53-4898980, email:?m.abayazid at utwente.nl?department website:?https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.ram.ewi.utwente.nl_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xjpravkpokrazq8qlzhld4wqbr4prb0tqbwdeh2jlxe&s=xasvvyyx6k1dz-dvaljkcdbqrnmmfdc3cyldh-9sdfy&e=.? please send your application with c.v. (including contact information for at least one academic references such as the msc supervisor) and transcripts from your bachelors and/or masters degrees as a single pdf file before november 15th?2018. our offer we offer a very challenging fulltime position for four years in an inspiring multidisciplinary and international environment. in accordance with the collective labour agreement for dutch universities (cao nu) the gross monthly salary ranges from ? 2266,- in the first year to ? 2897,- in the fourth year. additionally, the university of twente provides excellent facilities for professional and personal development, a holiday allowance and an end-of-year bonus, and a number of additional benefits. your main responsibility will be to carry out research, but you will be given the opportunity to acquire some teaching experience as well. the organization the university of twente.?we stand for life sciences and technology. high tech and human touch. education and research that matter. new technology which leads change, innovation and progress in society. the university of twente is the only campus university of the netherlands; divided over five faculties we provide more than fifty educational programmes. we have a strong focus on personal development and talented researchers are given scope for carrying out groundbreaking research. we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. because of our diversity values we do particularly support women to apply. the faculty of electrical engineering, mathematics and computer science (eemcs)?comprises three disciplines that shape information and communication technology. ict is more than communication. in almost every product we use mathematics, electronics and computer technology and ict now contributes to all of societies' activities. the faculty works together intensively with industrial partners and researchers in the netherlands and abroad and conducts extensive research for external commissioning parties and funders. the research which enjoys a high profile both at home and internationally, has been accommodated in the multidisciplinary research institutes: mesa+ institute, techmed centra and digital society institute.

subject: multiple open positions for roboticists  (jr/sr) - vio - 3d perception - navigation
content: intermodalics creates software for robots. we're a young team of engineers that could convince many companies and organisations world-wide of making industry-grade reliable robotic systems out of open-source software. we create software for indoor/outdoor autonomous systems, 2d/3d perception and autonomous navigation and manipulation. do you want to work in a team of ubuntu/ros/pcl programmers and get your hands on the most advanced robotic hardware and software world-wide ? then please have a look on our jobs page: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.intermodalics.eu_jobs&d=dwibaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jq4dmpwniehqvphquwyvlpkpw-_vme4l2dghsllwiw4&s=df7mt0xb46dx5kvn9l9oxtrvqodcjq-oq8z7ni-5ama&e= and apply at intermodalics ! at intermodalics, we believe that you should enjoy what you do. for us, work is about having fun, being challenged, and finding balance. we define our success based on both the quality of the work we deliver, and the quality of the lives we lead. when you work at intermodalics, you will help solve problems on the edge of what is possible. you will have time to take space from difficult problems, to mull things over in the shower, and to think deeply about your work. we focus on making the right decisions and on the quality of our products. intermodalics is creating software for robots world-wide, get in touch with us to learn more ! --  peter soetens, roboticist - founder intermodalics - gaston geenslaan 9, 3001 heverlee - belgium www.intermodalics.eu

subject: 15 marie-curie joint phds on  "autonomous intraluminal surgery" - towards autonomous robotic navigation  through the vasculature, the ureter and the colon
content: dear colleagues, dear future phd-candidates,  we wish to point you to the closing deadline for 15 phd vacancies in the framework of the atlas marie-curie training network. candidates will obtain joint phd's from 2 renowned european universities active in surgical robotics. with atlas we wish to make a major step towards autonomous surgery in intraluminal applications: autonomously navigating through lumens such as the vasculature, the ureter or the colon.    please refer to https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=seatxfqcjkmyjqrab6ohxtb71qnftmyprv5edg3ekqs&s=ecvyumknb4stsipqxwta9epn7imyjjkclylza7raqty&e= for more information.  the first call for esrs 1,2,3,4,7,9,10 and 12 will close on january 15 ! this being said, wishing you all a superb 2019 ! e. vander poorten in name of the assembled scientific supervisors of atlas  g. borghesan, j. de schutter, j. vander sloten, m. ourak, j. dankelman, p. breedveld, b. rosa, f. nageotte, m. gora, m. de mathelin, n. padoy, p. renaud, e. de momi, g. ferrigno, p. fiorini, d. dall'alba, a. menciassi, s. tognarelli and a. casals dr. e.b. vander poorten,?assist. prof.  surgical robotics, haptic interfacing, teleoperation & training faculty of engineering technology, university of leuven????? celestijnenlaan 300b, b-3001 heverlee, belgium?????  emmanuel.vanderpoorten at kuleuven.be  tel: +32/(0)16.32.25.28??

subject: marie curie - phd position in medical  robotics: distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (kul  sssa)
content: we are looking for highly motivated candidates to fill in a phd position on: *distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (esr3)* the interaction between flexible instrument bodies and surrounding  deformable lumens is intrinsically complex and hard to oversee if not  explicitly measured. esr3 identifies and integrates optimal sensing  technology for real-time proprioception along the deformable body. this project includes real time shape estimation based on optical  measurements such as fbgs or relying on electromagnetic (em) tracking.  it explores new sensing methods such as electrical impedance tomography  (eit) or algorithms that estimate the contact location and amplitude of  the interaction force based on the acquired shape estimates. automatic  calibration and registration techniques will be developed, so that  resulting techniques may be employed ?out of the box? requiring minimal  effort and tuning prior to deployment. (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_vacancies_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=jnkfhv9gau2ogsies_b6mm4kvknsakfg303vtd_xtla&e=) the ph.d. is part of the marie curie innovative training network atlas. the ph.d. will be hosted by - ku leuven, belgium (primary institution) - scuola superiore sant'anna, pisa italy. atlas (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=exnpyw2nkljqhixgbsd56-yhar8sn08mhfa6nodgul4&e=) is a marie curie itn-ejd project  (innovative training network ? european joint doctorate, ga no 813782)  that targets the training of experts in a very specific branch of  robotic surgery. within this scheme, 15 ph.d. positions are funded. the consortium is formed by - ku leuven - belgium - tu delft  - the netherlands - universit? de strasbourg - france - politecnico di milano - italy - universit? di verona - italy - scuola superiore sant?anna ? italy (pisa) - universitat polit?cnica de catalunya ?  spain  (barcellona) upon successful completion, each ph.d. candidate will be awarded a  double ph.d. degree. more information on how to apply can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_recruitment-2dprocedure_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=omyp6v44qu1zkk9-8eoqbbhw4wtqj_idehjb5ihypoa&e= envisioned closing date for application submission is 7th of march. --  ------------------------------------------------ gianni borghesan, phd robot assisted surgery group robotics research group ku leuven, department of mechanical engineering, division of pma room 04.214 celestijnenlaan 300b, b-3001 heverlee, belgium. tel: +32 163 29267 ------------------------------------------------

subject: research assistant in the domain of  autonomous inland shipping, ku leuven, belgium
content: the robotics research at ku leuven department of mechanical engineering has pioneered robotics research in europe since the mid-1970s. it has covered virtually all aspects of sensor-based robotics, from the high-level task specification down to low-level sensor-based control, and applied the research results in a variety of industrial applications. in the last decade the group shifted its attention towards advanced industrial robot assistants, and active sensing. the intelligent mobile platform (imp) group is a multi-disciplinary and multi-campus research group originating from the robotics research with a focus on the intelligent design and control of the mobile platforms of the future with a special focus on waterway transport applications. the industrial relevance of the department's research activities is witnessed by its many spin-off companies and its tradition of close industry collaboration in numerous european, national, and bilateral projects. website unit:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__https-3a__www.mech.kuleuven.be_en_pma_research_robotics_research_applications_imp&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=3frqogycdv_-os1vjw4nhfuuyg9x1jhqvjszke7chka&s=5ljnm3de6hbiqgmdz3w31iizadtujlqfiqahkcl7tve&e=  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__https-3a__www.mech.kuleuven.be_en_pma_research_robotics_research_applications_imp&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=3frqogycdv_-os1vjw4nhfuuyg9x1jhqvjszke7chka&s=5ljnm3de6hbiqgmdz3w31iizadtujlqfiqahkcl7tve&e= >   responsibilities: autonomous trucks are emerging on our highways demonstrating the opportunities of translating mobile robotics sensor and software technology from the lab to the road. safe autonomous navigating in a unstructured environment, including multiple unpredictable vehicles, remains challenging and of primary concern to both the technology developers and the legislative government. another emerging field is autonomous shipping that faces similar challenges but at a different time and complexity scale. our research group is performing research both at vessel and at cloud level. at vessel level we are developing new types of perception by fusing point cloud sensor data with other available information and we are investigating alternative propulsion systems (hydrogen or wind assisted). at cloud level we are working on a digital twin that is represented using a dynamic ienc map to improve data sharing and facilitate autonomous shipping on the large scale. we are looking for a candidate that is interested in at least one of these previously described  topics (perception - propulsion - digital twin).  profile: you are the holder of a master's degree in engineering technology, engineering science, computer science or equivalent. you have a critical attitude and perseverance to participate in research projects.  you have a strong analytic mind that is able to translate mathematical constraints in to practical considerations. maritime experience or knowledge is a big asset (sailing license, ...).   you can work independently and pro-actively, you have a sense of order and you are accurate and stress resistant.  you are analytical, results-oriented and student centered.  you will assist in the education of the program in engineering technology by cooperating in projects, exercise sessions and lab sessions. you have good communication skills (written and spoken) in english. knowledge of dutch is an asset. hands-on experience with robot platforms and sensor systems (vision, force, ?) are a plus. software development will be an important part of your core research. the following elements will be considered in the evaluation: proficiency in (or willingness to learn) multiple programming paradigms (object-oriented, procedural, functional, declarative), possibly with different general purposes languages (c/c++, python, matlab, ...) experience with existing robotics middleware (orocos, ros, moos-ivp, ...) experience with existing database frameworks (with preference to no sql and graph-based databases) experience with implementing planning, control or estimation algorithms experiences with model-driven engineering approach contributions to free and open source software projects (also beyond the topic of the project) are a plus. if so, please list them clearly in your application or send us your portfolio in your motivation letter or extended cv description, please consider to mention your previous experiences and skills which may help to make relevant contributions to the research group. offer: we offer a challenging research job within running vlaio, efro, and h2020 projects combined with an attractive salary package. we currently offer a research position in a stimulating and multi-disciplinary environment and with a strong industry network. after a positive evaluation the candidate could be offered a phd position depending on his/her ambitions. your job location will be in leuven. a start date in the course of 2019 (preferably before september 2019) is to be agreed upon. interested? for more information please contact prof. dr. ir. peter slaets, tel.: +32 16 32 27 73, mail: peter.slaets at kuleuven.be or dr. muhammad raheel afzal, tel.: +32 16 19 40 85, mail: raheel.afzal at kuleuven.be. you can apply for this job no later than june 28, 2019 via  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.kuleuven.be_eapplyingforjobs_light_55094023&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=3frqogycdv_-os1vjw4nhfuuyg9x1jhqvjszke7chka&s=5qwnowg5lpu-kn-5p9-3qweh8xuepfppjmx6a2rwvsm&e=  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.kuleuven.be_eapplyingforjobs_light_55094023&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=3frqogycdv_-os1vjw4nhfuuyg9x1jhqvjszke7chka&s=5qwnowg5lpu-kn-5p9-3qweh8xuepfppjmx6a2rwvsm&e= >  . ku leuven seeks to foster an environment where all talents can flourish, regardless of gender, age, cultural background, nationality or impairments. if you have any questions relating to accessibility or support, please contact at diversiteit.at kuleuven.be. -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=3frqogycdv_-os1vjw4nhfuuyg9x1jhqvjszke7chka&s=kcdd5xcaxkzgqzwq4stynde4vlfn1ih34-ob2zefdpk&e=

subject: phd positions in robotics at ku leuven  - belgium
content: dear colleagues, at the robotics research group, department of mechanical engineering, ku leuven, we are looking for excellent phd candidates: phd position on robot programming by demonstration https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_55269273-3fhl-3den-26lang-3den&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zcycgjnp11-z7sf1spqepbdyolxkstql0j8xbxq8844&s=ucisyx9vjvpo2veuh_3pjqny4y88pdtfmebcjcjofyg&e=  phd position on skills for human-robot collaboration https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.kuleuven.be_personeel_jobsite_jobs_55267156-3fhl-3den-26lang-3den&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=zcycgjnp11-z7sf1spqepbdyolxkstql0j8xbxq8844&s=atmwcuglsun_ya-ceirzc40m9dtdsudj3c1ae7ofg1k&e=  location: leuven, belgium application deadline: october 15, 2019 the positions can be filled in earlier if excellent candidates are found. postdoc candidates with a strong interest/background in the topics of the positions are also invited to apply. ku leuven is an institution for research and education with international appeal, located in the heart of europe. the university ranks among the best 50 universities worldwide, and tops the reuters ranking of europe's most innovative universities. the robotics group started its activities in the mid-1970s and was among the first to develop active force feedback for assembly operations. already in 1980 it developed learning insertion algorithms based on stochastic automata. it has covered virtually all aspects of sensor-based robotics, from the high-level task specification down to low-level sensor-based control, and applied the research results in a variety of industrial applications. in the last decade the group shifted its attention towards service robots (behavior-based mobile manipulation, shared control, learning control), medical robotics (natural interfaces, haptic bilateral control), industrial robot assistants, and active sensing. the group has initiated several free and open-source software projects in robotics, including orocos, kdl and etasl. kind regards, wilm decr? -- dr. ir. wilm decr? research manager ku leuven department of mechanical engineering, division pma  member of flanders make celestijnenlaan 300 - box 2420 3001 heverlee belgium tel. +32 16 37 26 86 fax +32 16 32 28 38 wilm.decre at kuleuven.be
